result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard C. Nitschke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:38 p.m.  Defendant Richard C. Nitschke in court with attorney Corey Mehlos. Attorney Corey Mehlos appearing telephonically with leave of Court.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm13, 15cf117, 15cf119 and 15cf257. Mehlos states he sent Affidavit of missing property to DA's office and Branch 2 JA today at 11:00 a.m. by facsimile. Sowinski states DA's office is in receipt of facsimile and discussions with Attorney Mehlos regarding return of property - Requests Court decide on return of property not agreed upon. Court states nothing was filed with Clerk - nothing was faxed to his office. Mehlos requests adjournment to arrange for affidavit and 25 page attachment to be sent to Judge. Sowinski requests recess to make copy for Judge. Recess 2:42 p.m. 
On record 2:48 p.m. - Court in receipt of Affidavit and number of attachments - appears one page of Attachment A appears to be missing - Court questions what is Item E-11 - Mehlos states that it is One facial air filter system - Defendant statement that it is a face mask for painting - Sowinski statement that Sheriff believes it was used in production of methaphetamine and is contraband. Mehlos - statement to interpretation of statute/Court statement/Sowinski statement. Court allows return of Item E-11. 
Item E-31 - Mehlos/Sowinski statement - Court finds that reasonable to infer that items were used for purposes of ingesting controlled substances and will not be returned.
Item E-34 - Court finds smoking device containing burned resins - is contraband and should not be returned. Other items do not constitute contraband and are to be returned.
Item E-37 - Court finds on face that contents are akin to items in E-31 and are implements for smoking or ingesting controlled substances. Items will not be returned.
Item E-38 - Same analysis - not returned
Item E-45 - Mehlos/Sowinski statement - Court statement that 968.13(1a) -definition includes "without limitation" to allow interpretation. Court finds items are commonly used to store drug paraphernalia. Journal and ledger - Court finds journal may be returned and metal piece of jewelry and altoids may be returned. Balance of items constitute contraband.
Attachment B - 
E - 2 in Attachment A - Court - no indication that firearms were used and may be returned.
E - 3 in Attachment B - glass will not be returned; paper concerning numbers. Court finds Item E-3 may be returned.
Paragraph 6 of Affidavit - Attachment C - Item E-1 round plastic container with vials - suggest possible use of controlled substance; round blue container - suggests same - Court finds Item E-1 may be returned.
Item E-11 in Attachment C - given actual presence of white powder - reasonable inference is that items constitute drug paraphernalia and will not be returned.
E-12 - Court finds that reasonable inference is drug paraphernalia and will not be returned.
E-27 - in Attachment C - Court returns paper containing phone number; inference for other items was that it was used for drug use - and will not be returned.
Item E-30 - Court finds drug paraphernalia and items will not be returned.
Balance of Affidavit - includes Samsung Note 6 cell phone - Sowinski/Mehlos statement - Court finds no challenge to search warrant was made following seizure of phone - if law enforcement was not able to execute search because of missing "access code" Court rules that search should be completed prior to return of item. Mehlos further statement. Court finds that it appears that there is a search warrant authorizing law enforcement to search contents of phone. Court finds search is not able to be done because Defendant has not turned over access code - law enforcement has right to examine unless search warrant is found to be illegal - Court will not order that access code be divulged by defendant; but if defendant chooses not to provide code - phone will not be returned. Mehlos - Requests permission to contact Barbour to obtain copy of search warrant - Court states issue will be revisited if assumptions concluded by Court are proved wrong. Attorney Mehlos to prepare and provide draft order to Attorney Sowinski - if no objections within 5 days, Court will sign order. Adj. 3:35 pm
Motion hearing on November 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

11:13 a.m. Defendant Richard C. Nitschke in court with attorney Corey Mehlos.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14CM133, 15CF13, 15CF117 and 15CF119. Sentencing on Count 1 in 15cf113, Count 3 in 15cf117 and Count 5 in 15cf119. Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement filed as to Counts  1&3 in 15cf13; Count  2 in 15cf117 and Counts 3&4 in 15cf119. Court questions defendant re understanding of DEJ. Court does not have calendar for 2020 for scheduling review date - Counsel to obtain date for review hearing. Court has received documents from Attorney Mehlos concerning sentencing. Court received lengthy letter from Attorney Mehlos today, along with character letters. Mehlos presents additional letters to Court for review. Mehlos calls Deb Smith, Oneida County Social Services as witness. Smith statement. Court statement to information in CHIPS proceeding. Mehlos calls J.N. as witness; J.N. statement. Sowinski statement on sentencing. Parties stipulate that restitution to victim in 14cm133 and costs be taken from cash bond not forfeited. Mehlos requests clarification that July 8th ruling regarding stipulation for payment from bond forfeitures in 15cf117 and 15cf119. Mehlos statement to DEJ requirement of bond conditions which include several no contact provisions - requests no contact provisions and no intoxicants - no taverns provisions be removed and notes filings related to bond posted in 15cf12. Court - bond posted in 15cf12 - Notice of Forfeiture entered on 5/18/15 - objection filed within 30 days - no judgment has been entered - for reasons stated on 7/8 - reason to justify forfeiture of bonds  - all cash need not be forfeited - bonds subject to judgment of forfeiture remain forfeited - other bonds would not be forfeited. When 15cf12 is resolved, a determination of bond posted will be made by Court. Mehlos statement that forfeited bond amount would be used for court costs and restitution pursuant to language of stipulation of parties - Court reiterates that in cases where judgment has been entered - ruling on 7/8 was intended to indicate that money that has been relinquished to County Treasurer pursuant to judgment will remain with County Treasurer. Mehlos statement on sentencing. Defendant statement on sentencing. Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence-all CC
15cf13 - Count 1 
15cf117 - Count 3
15cf119 - Count 5

Jail - 60 days with Huber for all purposes. To commence on/before Sunday, September 11, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. 
Jail credit - to be stipulated by parties - Court will sign order after written stipulation filed.

CC/DNA Surcharge
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).

Bail continued in all cases. 
Appeal rights given. 
Adj. 12:14 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for November 21, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
from Attorney Mehlos

10:02 a.m. Defendant Richard C. Nitschke in court with attorney Corey Mehlos.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf117, 15cf257, 15tr1960, 15tr1961, 15tr1959, 14cm133, 15tr1958, 15cf119, 15cf13. Sowinski states agreement. In 15cf117 State moves to amend Count 3 to Misdemeanor Bail Jumping - Granted; State moves to dismiss but read-in Count 1 - Granted. In 15cf119, State moves to amend Count 5 to Misdemeanor Bail Jumping - Granted; State moves to dismiss but read in Counts 1 and 2 - Granted. In 15cf13, State moves to dismiss but read-in Counts 2, 4 and 5 - Granted. In 15cf257, State moves to dismiss all counts - Granted. In 15tr1960, 15tr1961, 15tr1959 and 15tr1958-State moves to dismiss - Granted. In 14cm133 - State moves to have restitution paid from bond posted in 2015 CF cases. 
Court considers motion for bond forfeitures. Court states in 15cf13 - $5,000 cash bond was posted - Notices mailed - Judgment not entered; in 15cf257, $1,000 cash bond was posted - Notices mailed - Judgment not entered. In 15cf117 and 15cf119 - Notices mailed; no objections filed timely; Judgment entered - Court statement to motion for bond forfeitures -  cites Wis. Stat. 969.13(4), State v. Achterberg and State V. Huggins. Court finds language in statute mandates court to enter judgment if State moves; interpreting that language as not precluding all discretion to enter judgment. Circumstances in this matter do not demand that Court forfeit all bond posted; however, forfeiture of bond in 15cf117 and 15cf119 was  justified. Forfeiture of bond in 15cf13 and 15cf257 - not demanded by facts of case. 

Defendant enters pleas of No contest to all remaining counts.  Three plea questionnaires filed. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Count 3 in 15cf117, Count 5 in 15cf119, and Counts 6 in 15cf13.  - Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists, accepts the pleas, and defers entry of judgment for Count 2 in 15cf117, Count 3 and 4 in 15cf119 and Counts 1 and 3 in 15cf13. Written Deferred Entry of Judgment agreement to be filed within 10 days. 
Mehlos - requests additional time for sentencing hearing due to the short notice of hearing. Court requests written DEJ by next hearing date. Bail continued in all cases. Adj. 10:38 a.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 11:00 am.
request for adjournment - granted
Motion hearing on August 1, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
State's Exhibit 1 from Preliminary Hearing (original retained in Exhibit drawer)

1:45 p.m. Defendant Richard C. Nitschke in court with attorney Corey Mehlos.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Defendant Andrea D. Healy in court with attorney Richard Shawl. Calling 12tr2423, 12tr2422, 12cf196, 15cf12,15cf116, 15tr1959, 15tr1960, 15tr1958, 15tr1961, 15cf13, 15cf119, 15cf257, 15cf117, 15cf119, 14cm133. Sowinski statement to proceeding today- agreement reached on Andrea Healy's cases, Shawl will argue that OWI be amended to reckless driving, preliminary hearings will be held in 15cf117, 15cf119 and 15cf257, motion to reconsider forfeiture of bond filed by Mehlos. Shawl states not ready to proceed to plea/sentencing today, would like to argue amendment of OWI charge. 
In 12cf196 - Motion to amend OWI charge to reckless driving. Sowinski statement to motion and factors to meet requirements of Wis. Stat. 967.055. Court notes he has previously viewed lengthy recording of Trooper Detienne's traffic stop. Shawl statement to motion and factors to meet requirements of Wis. Stat. 967.055. Court statement. Court finds that amending OWI charge not contrary to public interest and is being made to facilitate resolution of pending criminal matters and will approve amendment if State so moves. 
Court asks Attorney Shawl if defense in position to enter plea today on all matters. Shawl states needs some time to review plea questionnaire. Sowinski states motion for bond forfeiture could be made and Attorney Shawl could review plea questionnaire with defendant. Shawl requests leave of Court to review plea questionnaire. State has no objections. Shawl statement - does not wish to participate in any of bond forfeiture cases. Recess only on 12cf196 2:18 p.m. 
Still present in court Defendant Nitschke, Attorney Mehlos, ADA Sowinski and Eric Klemm.
Mehlos statement - would like to have motions on bond forfeitures heard next - Poster of bond (Jesse Miller) in 15cf13 is available by telephone. 
On record 2:33 p.m. - Jesse Miller now appearing by telephone with leave of court. Mehlos statement to motion for de novo review of bond forfeiture. Court swears Miller. Court questions Miller. Mehlos direct of Miller. Sowinski cross of Miller. 2:43 p.m. - Miller excused. Court statement - Court finds 15cf13 - notice of forfeiture was dated 5-18-15; objection was filed; Court finds no judgment has been entered 15cf13. 15cf117 and 15cf119 - notices of bond forfeiture were sent on 11-5-15 - no response or objection was filed - Judgment of Forfeiture were entered on 1-15-16. In 15cf117 and 15cf119 - no timely objection was filed and no third-party involved. In 15cf117 and 15cf119 - Mehlos statement - third party posted but money was defendant's. Mehlos refers to 969.13(4), argues judgment needs to be vacated since State never filed motion for forfeiture and defendant has 120 days to appeal pursuant to State v. Wickstrom. Sowinski - statement that bond forfeiture motions were filed by the State. Court cites State v. Achterberg, and finds Achterberg not applicable in this matter since no objection was timely filed. Sowinski statement - State has no objection to returning Mr. Miller's money and then defendant needs to either post or return to jail. Court finds that appeal rights under State v. Wickstrom are preserved as right is to appeal to Court of Appeals if motion is denied. Court would like to consider issue further and Court is taking motions under advisement.
Mehlos statement to Nitschke testimony to bond posted in 15cf12. In 15cf16-cash bond was modified to signature bond. In 15cf12, notice of forfeiture was filed, timely objection was filed and no judgment has been entered. Court finds Mr. Nitschke's right to challenge bond forfeiture is preserved.
Proceeding to preliminary hearing in 15cf117, 15cf119 and 15cf257. Court consolidates matters for purposes of preliminary hearing only. Recess 3:15 p.m. On record 3:25 p.m. State calls Rhinelander Police Department Investigator Kyle Parrish/witness sworn/direct by Sowinski/ witness ID's defendant / Mehlos cross/Sowinski further direct/Mehlos continued cross/Sowinski re-direct/ State marks Exhibit 1 (copy of report from State Crime Lab) in 15cf119 - received. Mehlos statement. Court finds probable cause in 15cf117, 15cf119 and 15cf257 and binds defendant over. Mehlos wishes to proceed to arraignment today. State files Information in all three cases - Mehlos enters not guilty pleas to all counts in all cases. Court schedules motion hearing for Friday, July 8, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. Motion hearing for all motions currently filed and continuation of bond forfeiture hearing. Any written arguments regarding bond forfeiture to be to Judge by Wednesday, July 6, 2016. Bail continued in all matters. Adj. 4:31 p.m.

4:34 p.m. Recalling State v. Healy, 12tr2423, 12tr2422, 12cf196, 15cf12, 15cf116. Defendant Andrea Healy with Attorney Richard Shawl in court. Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea hearing scheduled for July 8, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. State v. Healy will be heard prior to State v. Nitschke. Bail continued. Adj. 4:36 p.m.
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

2:03 p.m. Calling 14cm133, 12tr2422 12tr2423, 15tr1958, 15tr1959, 15tr1960, 15tr1961, 15cf117, 15cf119, 12cf196, 15cf12, 15cf116, 15cf13, 15cf257. Defendant Richard C. Nitschke in court with attorney Corey Mehlos.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also present Defendant Andrea D. Healy in court with Attorney Richard Shawl. Amended Motion to Suppress filed - Mehlos needs to be heard. Shawl Motion to Confidential Informant's needs to be heard. Court questions attorneys re Motion to be addressed - Mehlos - Motion to dismiss Information filed on 5/29/15 in 15cf13, disclose ID of confidential informants in 15cf13. Several motions re bond forfeiture in 15cf13, 15cf117 and 15cf119. Shawl - no further motions pending on behalf of Healy except a bond forfeiture filed previously. Schiek anticipates one-half day; Shawl and Mehlos - agree one-half day hearing is necessary. Mehlos states he will be filing additional motions after these motions are heard. Motions to be heard on June 23, 2016 are those mentioned above. Any additional motions filed by counsel must be formally noticed for June 23, 2016. Bail continued. Adj. 2:15 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

02:56 pm - Defendant Richard C. Nitschke in court, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf117, 15cf119 (AIA) and 15cf13.  Corey Mehlos represents in 15cf13.  In cases 15cf117 and 15cf119 - Mehlos does not represent until arrangements can be made for a retainer. records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 03:55 pm - Defendant Richard C. Nitschke in court with attorney Corey Mehlos.  Defendant Richard C. Nitschke in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf13, 15cf117, 15cf119.  Mehlos files PFAC - Defendant was found to be ineligible for PD appointment.  Court finds the defendant ineligible for court appointment of an attorney.  Mehlos/Michlig statement to motion.  Court states a property bond is a potential solution to bond modification.  A property bond in the amount of $150,000.00 would be acceptable to be applied to all three cases - Three requirements - 1. Title Policy or some other evidence from a title company confirming Defendant holds clear title to the applical real estate.  2.  Evidence establishing $150,000.00 value.  3. Mortgage - Nitschke, Oneida County Mortgagee.  Mehlos statement to cash bond in 15cf13 - Mehlos states Bednar would accept $5,000.00 for all three cases.  Court will not forfeit $5,000.00 cash at this time.  Court amends 15cf117 to $5,000 cash.  In regards to potential property bond - if documentation is provided - court will then review and approve.  Adjourned - 04:20 pm
Requesting telephonic appearance - Granted
